items.fromString:
Hi [~accountid:62780ad493111000689ece08] ! Taggares ended up filling out some employees' IDs manually and this one got a bit out of sync. Could you help update the Employee ID sequence for this site for the next new hire to be ID *4031*

[~accountid:617c35f1b9c549006f165a00] with the leading zero fix that you have, is there anything else that is needed to make sure that remains true? If Daniel sets it up to be 4031 does that mean it will automatically change to 004031? Hopefully it does, but I just wanted to confirm.

Thank you!
items.toString:
-Hi- [~accountid:62780ad493111000689ece08] -! Taggares ended up filling out some employees' IDs manually and this one got a bit out of sync. Could you help update the Employee ID sequence for this site for the next new hire to be ID- *-4031-*

[~accountid:617c35f1b9c549006f165a00] -with the leading zero fix that you have, is there anything else that is needed to make sure that remains true? If Daniel sets it up to be 4031 does that mean it will automatically change to 004031? Hopefully it does, but I just wanted to confirm.-

-Thank you!- 

06/12 UPDATE: See comment below

items.fromString: They will start hiring on this site soon and they would like the ID to automatically produce
items.toString: They have already started hiring and will be hiring more tomorrow. Hopefully, we can get this updated today if possible!

items.fromString:
Hi All! Could you help update the Employee ID sequence for this site for the next new hire to be ID *3858*

Thank you!

[~accountid:617c35f1b9c549006f165a00] with the leading zero fix that you have, is there anything else that is needed to make sure that remains true? If Daniel sets it up to be 4031 does that mean it will automatically change to 004031? Hopefully it does, but I just wanted to confirm.

Thank you!

[~accountid:617c35f1b9c549006f165a00] -with the leading zero fix that you have, is there anything else that is needed to make sure that remains true? If Daniel sets it up to be 4031 does that mean it will automatically change to 004031? Hopefully it does, but I just wanted to confirm.-

fields.customfield_10131: They have already started hiring and will be hiring more tomorrow. Hopefully, we can get this updated today if possible!
fields.summary: CLONE - Taggares Fruit Company -  #1328 - Employee ID Sequence - update pt. 2

comments.body: Confirmed, yes.  The counter in the {{demeter.company}} record is still an integer, so treat this just like any other company.
Can do! Thank you so much [~accountid:62780ad493111000689ece08]
To be clear, I took no action.  I just answered the question.
Ah thank you [~accountid:617c35f1b9c549006f165a00] . [~accountid:62780ad493111000689ece08]  and I slacked on this one yesterday since it was expedited and he let me know it had been completed.

My Sincere apologies team—The customer is claiming that this update wasn’t completed in time and that they are now up to ID 4033. I’m not sure if this was a miscommunication on their side but it seems like they didn’t use the auto-generated IDs at all during their last few hires 😖 Is it possible to update this so that their next ID is 4033? They will be hiring again tomorrow.

The counter is now set to {{4032}}, which means that the next hire should get {{4033}}.

Before the change the counter was at {{4030}}

[~accountid:613e6eaa1238e8007108f513] Either I’m pulling cached data somehow or your changes aren’t taking effect.



{noformat}SELECT id, name, updated_at, employee_id_counter FROM demeter.company WHERE id = 1328{noformat}

{noformat}"id"	"name"	"updated_at"	"employee_id_counter"
1328	"Taggares Fruit Company"	"2023-03-25 00:08:14.318315"	"{""default"": 4030}"{noformat}



This should not matter though.

The company already has persons with employee_ids "004030", "004031", "004032".
When they use the counter, if the logic works correctly, it should see that and come up with "004033", where it will continue sequentially until they hit "004343" which is already used...

[~accountid:617c35f1b9c549006f165a00]  



thanks for double checking. Not sure what happened. Maybe I forgot to commit the change. 
It’s fixed now. 



{noformat}SELECT id, name, updated_at, employee_id_counter FROM demeter.company WHERE id = 1328;{noformat}

{noformat}id,     name,                   updated_at,                  employee_id_counter
1328,   Taggares Fruit Company, 2023-03-25 00:08:14.318315,"{""default"": 4032}"{noformat}

|(the updated_at counter, doesn’t get updated when you do the DB update, unless you manually update the date)

fields.description: We have Palo Alto ready to go live! Can we please set their ID Sequence to *7100*
fields.customfield_10131: Anytime this week would be fantastic!
